original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 322.60/90 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed at 322.60/90 to the US dollar on Wednesday from 321.50/322.00 the previous day, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2025 closed at 13.50/80 percent from 13.60/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2026, closed at 13.80/90 percent from 13.80/14.00 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.01.2027 closed at 13.90/14.00 percent from 13.80/95 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 closed at 14.10/20 percent from 14.15/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 closed stable at 14.15/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2032 closed at 14.20/40 percent, from 14.25/40 percent.

Sri Lanka’s Treasury bills yields were largely unchanged at Wednesday’s auction with 155.1 billion rupees out of 160 billion rupees offered bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed. (Colombo/Jan3/2024)
